snippet: Revelations in the United States that a Google employee had informed colleagues that his program would collect personal data has cast doubt on the company’s excuses.
abstract: European privacy regulators are considering reopening their inquiries into Google's collection of personal e-mails and Web searches for its Street View service; move comes after revelations in the United States that the activity had not been a lone programmer's error, and that others at the company had been told about it.

byline.contributor: David Streitfeld contributed reporting from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Revelations in the United States that a Google employee had informed colleagues that his program would collect personal data has cast doubt on the company’s excuses.

headline.seo: European Regulators May Reopen Google Street View Inquiries
headline.main: European Regulators May Reopen Street View Inquiries
